017package org.parboiled.parserunners;
018
019import org.parboiled.MatchHandler;
020import org.parboiled.MatcherContext;
021import org.parboiled.Rule;
022import org.parboiled.buffers.InputBuffer;
023import org.parboiled.buffers.MutableInputBuffer;
024import org.parboiled.common.ImmutableLinkedList;
025import org.parboiled.common.ImmutableList;
026import org.parboiled.common.Preconditions;
027import org.parboiled.errors.InvalidInputError;
028import org.parboiled.matchers.*;
029import org.parboiled.matchervisitors.*;
030import org.parboiled.support.MatcherPath;
031import org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult;
032
033import java.util.ArrayList;
034import java.util.List;
035
036import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
037import static imagingbook.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkState;
038import static imagingbook.parboiled.support.Chars.*;
039
040/**
041 * A {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.ParseRunner} implementation that is able to recover from {@link org.parboiled.errors.InvalidInputError}s in the input and therefore
042 * report more than just the first {@link org.parboiled.errors.InvalidInputError} if the input does not conform to the rule grammar.
043 * Error recovery is done by attempting to either delete an error character, insert a potentially missing character
044 * or do both at once (which is equivalent to a one char replace) whereby this implementation is able to determine
045 * itself which of these options is the best strategy.
046 * If the parse error cannot be overcome by either deleting, inserting or replacing one character a resynchronization
047 * rule is determined and the parsing process resynchronized, so that parsing can still continue.
048 * In this way the RecoveringParseRunner is able to completely parse all input texts (This ParseRunner never returns
049 * an unmatched {@link org.parboiled.support.ParsingResult}).
050 * If the input is error free this {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.ParseRunner} implementation will only perform one parsing run, with the same
051 * speed as the {@link org.parboiled.parserunners.BasicParseRunner}. However, if there are {@link org.parboiled.errors.InvalidInputError}s in the input potentially
052 * many more runs are performed to properly report all errors and test the various recovery strategies.
053 */
054public class RecoveringParseRunner<V> extends AbstractParseRunner<V> {
055    
056    public static class TimeoutException extends RuntimeException {
057        public final Rule rule;
058        public final InputBuffer inputBuffer;
059        public final ParsingResult<?> lastParsingResult;
060
061        public TimeoutException(Rule rule, InputBuffer inputBuffer, ParsingResult<?> lastParsingResult) {
062            this.rule = rule;
063            this.inputBuffer = inputBuffer;
064            this.lastParsingResult = lastParsingResult;
065        }
066    }
067
068    private final long timeoutNanos;
069    private long startTimeStamp;
070    private int errorIndex;
071    private InvalidInputError currentError;
072    private MutableInputBuffer buffer;
073    private ParsingResult<V> lastParsingResult;
074    private Matcher rootMatcherWithoutPTB; // the root matcher with parse tree building disabled
075
076    /**
077     * Create a new RecoveringParseRunner instance with the given rule and input text and returns the result of
078     * its {@link #run(String)} method invocation.
079     *
080     * @param rule  the parser rule to run
081     * @param input the input text to run on
082     * @return the ParsingResult for the parsing run
083     * @deprecated As of 0.11.0 you should use the "regular" constructor and one of the "run" methods rather than
084     *             this static method. This method will be removed in one of the coming releases.
085     */
086    @Deprecated
087    public static <V> ParsingResult<V> run(Rule rule, String input) {
088        checkArgNotNull(rule, "rule");
089        checkArgNotNull(input, "input");
090        return new RecoveringParseRunner<V>(rule).run(input);
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Creates a new RecoveringParseRunner instance for the given rule.
095     *
096     * @param rule the parser rule
097     */
098    public RecoveringParseRunner(Rule rule) {
099        this(rule, Long.MAX_VALUE);
100    }
101    
102    /**
103     * Creates a new RecoveringParseRunner instance for the given rule.
104     * A parsing run will throw a TimeoutException if it takes longer than the given number if milliseconds. 
105     *
106     * @param rule the parser rule
107     * @param timeoutMillis the timeout value in milliseconds
108     */
109    public RecoveringParseRunner(Rule rule, long timeoutMillis) {
110        super(rule);
111        if (timeoutMillis > Long.MAX_VALUE / 1000000) {
112            this.timeoutNanos = Long.MAX_VALUE;
113        } else {
114            this.timeoutNanos = timeoutMillis * 1000000;
115        }
116    }
117
118    public ParsingResult<V> run(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
119        checkArgNotNull(inputBuffer, "inputBuffer");
120        startTimeStamp = System.nanoTime();
121        resetValueStack();
122
123        // first, run a basic match
124        ParseRunner<V> basicRunner = new BasicParseRunner<V>(getRootMatcher())
125                .withParseErrors(getParseErrors())
126                .withValueStack(getValueStack());
127        lastParsingResult = basicRunner.run(inputBuffer);
128
129        if (!lastParsingResult.matched) {
130            // for better performance disable parse tree building during the recovery runs
131            rootMatcherWithoutPTB = (Matcher) getRootMatcher().suppressNode();
132
133            // locate first error
134            performLocatingRun(inputBuffer);
135            checkState(errorIndex >= 0); // we failed before so we must fail again
136
137            // in order to be able to apply fixes we need to wrap the input buffer with a mutability wrapper
138            buffer = new MutableInputBuffer(inputBuffer);
139
140            // report first error
141            performReportingRun();
142
143            // fix and report until done
144            while (!fixError(errorIndex)) {
145                performReportingRun();
146            }
147
148            // rerun once more with parse tree building enabled to create a parse tree for the fixed input
149            if (!getRootMatcher().isNodeSuppressed()) {
150                performFinalRun();
151                checkState(lastParsingResult.matched);
152            }
153        }
154        return lastParsingResult;
155    }
156
157    private boolean performLocatingRun(InputBuffer inputBuffer) {
158        resetValueStack();
159        ParseRunner<V> locatingRunner = new ErrorLocatingParseRunner<V>(rootMatcherWithoutPTB, getInnerHandler())
160                .withParseErrors(getParseErrors())
161                .withValueStack(getValueStack());
162        lastParsingResult = locatingRunner.run(inputBuffer);
163        errorIndex = lastParsingResult.matched ? -1 :
164                getParseErrors().remove(getParseErrors().size() - 1).getStartIndex();
165        return lastParsingResult.matched;
166    }
167
168    private void performReportingRun() {
169        resetValueStack();
170        ParseRunner<V> reportingRunner = new ErrorReportingParseRunner<V>(rootMatcherWithoutPTB, errorIndex,
171                getInnerHandler())
172                .withParseErrors(getParseErrors())
173                .withValueStack(getValueStack());
174        ParsingResult<V> result = reportingRunner.run(buffer);
175        Preconditions.checkState(!result.matched); // we failed before so we should really be failing again
176        currentError = (InvalidInputError) getParseErrors().get(getParseErrors().size() - 1);
177    }
178
179    private void performFinalRun() {
180        resetValueStack();
181        Handler handler = new Handler();
182        MatcherContext<V> rootContext = createRootContext(buffer, handler, false);
183        boolean matched = handler.match(rootContext);
184        lastParsingResult = createParsingResult(matched, rootContext);
185    }
186
187    private MatchHandler getInnerHandler() {
188        return errorIndex >= 0 ? new Handler() : null;
189    }
190
191    private boolean fixError(int fixIndex) {
192        if (tryFixBySingleCharDeletion(fixIndex)) return true;
193        int nextErrorAfterDeletion = errorIndex;
194
195        Character bestInsertionCharacter = findBestSingleCharInsertion(fixIndex);
196        if (bestInsertionCharacter == null) return true;
197        int nextErrorAfterBestInsertion = errorIndex;
198
199        Character bestReplacementCharacter = findBestSingleCharReplacement(fixIndex);
200        if (bestReplacementCharacter == null) return true;
201        int nextErrorAfterBestReplacement = errorIndex;
202
203        int nextErrorAfterBestSingleCharFix =
204                Math.max(Math.max(nextErrorAfterDeletion, nextErrorAfterBestInsertion), nextErrorAfterBestReplacement);
205        if (nextErrorAfterBestSingleCharFix > fixIndex) {
206            // we are able to overcome the error with a single char fix, so apply the best one found
207            if (nextErrorAfterBestSingleCharFix == nextErrorAfterDeletion) {
208                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, DEL_ERROR);
209                errorIndex = nextErrorAfterDeletion + 1;
210                currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(1);
211            } else if (nextErrorAfterBestSingleCharFix == nextErrorAfterBestInsertion) {
212                // we need to insert the characters in reverse order, since we insert twice at the same location
213                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, bestInsertionCharacter);
214                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, INS_ERROR);
215                errorIndex = nextErrorAfterBestInsertion + 2;
216                currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(2);
217            } else {
218                // we need to insert the characters in reverse order, since we insert three times at the same location
219                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex + 1, bestReplacementCharacter);
220                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex + 1, INS_ERROR);
221                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, DEL_ERROR);
222                errorIndex = nextErrorAfterBestReplacement + 5;
223                currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(1);
224            }
225        } else {
226            // we can't fix the error with a single char fix, so fall back to resynchronization
227            if (buffer.charAt(fixIndex) == EOI) {
228                buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, RESYNC_EOI);
229                currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(1);
230                return true;
231            }
232            buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, RESYNC);
233            currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(1);
234            performLocatingRun(buffer); // find the next parse error
235        }
236        return errorIndex == -1;
237    }
238
239    private boolean tryFixBySingleCharDeletion(int fixIndex) {
240        buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, DEL_ERROR);
241        boolean nowErrorFree = performLocatingRun(buffer);
242        if (nowErrorFree) {
243            currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(1); // compensate for the inserted DEL_ERROR char
244        } else {
245            buffer.undoCharInsertion(fixIndex);
246            errorIndex = Math.max(errorIndex - 1, 0);
247        }
248        return nowErrorFree;
249    }
250
251    @SuppressWarnings( {"ConstantConditions"})
252    private Character findBestSingleCharInsertion(int fixIndex) {
253        GetStarterCharVisitor getStarterCharVisitor = new GetStarterCharVisitor();
254        int bestNextErrorIndex = -1;
255        Character bestChar = '\u0000'; // non-null default
256        for (MatcherPath failedMatcherPath : currentError.getFailedMatchers()) {
257            Character starterChar = failedMatcherPath.element.matcher.accept(getStarterCharVisitor);
258            checkState(starterChar != null); // we should only have single character matchers
259            if (starterChar == EOI) {
260                continue; // we should never conjure up an EOI character (that would be cheating :)
261            }
262            buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, starterChar);
263            buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, INS_ERROR);
264            if (performLocatingRun(buffer)) {
265                currentError.shiftIndexDeltaBy(2); // compensate for the inserted chars
266                return null; // success, exit immediately
267            }
268            buffer.undoCharInsertion(fixIndex);
269            buffer.undoCharInsertion(fixIndex);
270            errorIndex = Math.max(errorIndex - 2, 0);
271
272            if (bestNextErrorIndex < errorIndex) {
273                bestNextErrorIndex = errorIndex;
274                bestChar = starterChar;
275            }
276        }
277        errorIndex = bestNextErrorIndex;
278        return bestChar;
279    }
280
281    private Character findBestSingleCharReplacement(int fixIndex) {
282        buffer.insertChar(fixIndex, DEL_ERROR);
283        Character bestChar = findBestSingleCharInsertion(fixIndex + 2);
284        if (bestChar == null) { // success, we found a fix that renders the complete input error free
285            currentError
286                    .shiftIndexDeltaBy(-1); // delta from DEL_ERROR char insertion and index shift by insertion method
287        } else {
288            buffer.undoCharInsertion(fixIndex);
289            errorIndex = Math.max(errorIndex - 3, 0);
290        }
291        return bestChar;
292    }
293
294    /**
295     * A {@link MatchHandler} implementation that recognizes the special
296     * {@link org.parboiled.support.Chars#RESYNC} character to overcome {@link InvalidInputError}s at the respective
297     * error indices.
298     */
299    private class Handler implements MatchHandler {
300        private final IsSingleCharMatcherVisitor isSingleCharMatcherVisitor = new IsSingleCharMatcherVisitor();
301        private int fringeIndex;
302        private MatcherPath lastMatchPath;
303
304        public boolean match(MatcherContext<?> context) {
305            Matcher matcher = context.getMatcher();
306            if (matcher.accept(isSingleCharMatcherVisitor)) {
307                if (prepareErrorLocation(context) && matcher.match(context)) {
308                    if (fringeIndex < context.getCurrentIndex()) {
309                        fringeIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
310                        lastMatchPath = context.getPath();
311                    }
312                    return true;
313                }
314                return false;
315            }
316
317            if (matcher.match(context)) {
318                return true;
319            }
320
321            // if we didn't match we might have to resynchronize
322            if (matcher instanceof SequenceMatcher) {
323                switch(context.getCurrentChar()) {
324                    case RESYNC:
325                    case RESYNC_START:
326                    case RESYNC_EOI:
327                        // however we only resynchronize if we are at a RESYNC location and the matcher is a SequenceMatcher
328                        // that has already matched at least one character and that is a parent of the last match
329                        return qualifiesForResync(context) && resynchronize(context);
330                }
331                
332                // check for timeout only on failures of sequences so as to not add too much overhead
333                if (System.nanoTime() - startTimeStamp > timeoutNanos) {
334                    throw new TimeoutException(getRootMatcher(), buffer, lastParsingResult);
335                }
336            }
337            return false;
338        }
339
340        private boolean qualifiesForResync(MatcherContext context) {
341            if (context.getCurrentIndex() == context.getStartIndex() || !context.getPath().isPrefixOf(lastMatchPath)) {
342                // if we have a sequence that hasn't match anything yet or is not a prefix we might still have to
343                // resync on it if there is no other sequence parent anymore
344                MatcherContext parent = context.getParent();
345                while (parent != null) {
346                    if (parent.getMatcher() instanceof SequenceMatcher) return false;
347                    parent = parent.getParent();
348                }
349            }            
350            return true;
351        }
352
353        private boolean prepareErrorLocation(MatcherContext context) {
354            switch (context.getCurrentChar()) {
355                case DEL_ERROR:
356                    return willMatchDelError(context);
357                case INS_ERROR:
358                    return willMatchInsError(context);
359                case RESYNC:
360                case RESYNC_START:
361                case RESYNC_EOI:
362                    return false;
363                default:
364                    return true;
365            }
366        }
367
368        private boolean willMatchDelError(MatcherContext context) {
369            int preSkipIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
370            context.advanceIndex(2); // skip del marker char and illegal char
371            if (!runTestMatch(context)) {
372                // if we wouldn't succeed with the match do not swallow the ERROR char & Co
373                context.setCurrentIndex(preSkipIndex);
374                return false;
375            }
376            context.setStartIndex(context.getCurrentIndex());
377            if (context.getParent() != null) context.getParent().markError();
378            return true;
379        }
380
381        private boolean willMatchInsError(MatcherContext context) {
382            int preSkipIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
383            context.advanceIndex(1); // skip ins marker char
384            if (!runTestMatch(context)) {
385                // if we wouldn't succeed with the match do not swallow the ERROR char
386                context.setCurrentIndex(preSkipIndex);
387                return false;
388            }
389            context.setStartIndex(context.getCurrentIndex());
390            context.markError();
391            return true;
392        }
393
394        private boolean runTestMatch(MatcherContext context) {
395            TestMatcher testMatcher = new TestMatcher(context.getMatcher());
396            MatcherContext testContext = testMatcher.getSubContext(context);
397            return prepareErrorLocation(testContext) && testContext.runMatcher();
398        }
399
400        private boolean resynchronize(MatcherContext context) {
401            context.markError();
402
403            // create a node for the failed Sequence, taking ownership of all sub nodes created so far
404            context.createNode();
405
406            // by resyncing we flip an unmatched sequence to a matched one, so in order to keep the value stack
407            // consistent we go into a special "error action mode" and execute the minimal set of actions underneath
408            // the resync sequence
409            rerunAndExecuteErrorActions(context);
410            
411            // skip over all characters that are not legal followers of the failed Sequence
412            switch (context.getCurrentChar()) {
413                case RESYNC:
414                    // this RESYNC error is the last error, we establish the length of the bad sequence and
415                    // change this RESYNC marker to a RESYNC_START / RESYNC_END block
416                    context.advanceIndex(1); // gobble RESYNC marker
417                    List<Matcher> followMatchers = new FollowMatchersVisitor().getFollowMatchers(context);
418                    int endIndex = gobbleIllegalCharacters(context, followMatchers);
419                    currentError.setEndIndex(endIndex);
420                    buffer.replaceInsertedChar(currentError.getStartIndex() - 1, RESYNC_START);
421                    buffer.insertChar(endIndex, RESYNC_END);
422                    context.advanceIndex(1); // gobble RESYNC_END marker
423                    break;
424
425                case RESYNC_START:
426                    // a RESYNC error we have already recovered from before
427                    context.advanceIndex(1); // gobble RESYNC_START
428                    while (context.getCurrentChar() != RESYNC_END) {
429                        context.advanceIndex(1); // skip all characters up to the RESYNC_END
430                        checkState(context.getCurrentChar() != EOI); // we MUST find a RESYNC_END before EOI
431                    }
432                    context.advanceIndex(1); // gobble RESYNC_END marker
433                    break;
434                
435                case RESYNC_EOI:
436                    // if we are resyncing on EOI we don't swallow anything
437                    // we also do not have to update the currentError since we only hit this code here
438                    // in the final run
439                    break;
440
441                default:
442                    throw new IllegalStateException();
443            }
444
445            return true;
446        }
447
448        @SuppressWarnings( {"ConstantConditions"})
449        private void rerunAndExecuteErrorActions(MatcherContext context) {
450            // the context is for the resync action, which at this point has FAILED, i.e. ALL its sub actions haven't
451            // had a chance to change the value stack, even the ones having run before the actual parse error matcher
452            // so we need to rerun all sub matchers of the resync sequence up to the point of the parse error
453            // and then run the minimal set of action in "error action mode"
454
455            int savedCurrentIndex = context.getCurrentIndex();
456            context.setCurrentIndex(context.getStartIndex()); // restart matching the resync sequence
457
458            boolean preError = true;
459            for (Matcher child : context.getMatcher().getChildren()) {
460                if (preError && !child.getSubContext(context).runMatcher()) {
461                    // run what will be the preceding matcher of all error actions
462                    new EmptyMatcher().getSubContext(context).runMatcher();
463                    context.setIntTag(1); // signal that at least one rule has run before the error actions
464                    preError = false;
465                }
466                if (!preError) {
467                    context.setInErrorRecovery(true);
468                    List<ActionMatcher> errorActions = child.accept(new CollectResyncActionsVisitor());
469                    checkState(errorActions != null);
470                    for (ActionMatcher errorAction : errorActions) {
471                        // execute the error actions without looking at their boolean results !!!
472                        errorAction.getSubContext(context).runMatcher();
473                    }
474                    context.setInErrorRecovery(false);
475                }
476            }
477
478            context.setCurrentIndex(savedCurrentIndex);
479        }
480
481        private int gobbleIllegalCharacters(MatcherContext context, List<Matcher> followMatchers) {
482            while_loop:
483            while (true) {
484                char currentChar = context.getCurrentChar();
485                if (currentChar == EOI) break;
486                for (Matcher followMatcher : followMatchers) {
487                    if (followMatcher.accept(new IsStarterCharVisitor(currentChar))) {
488                        break while_loop;
489                    }
490                }
491                context.advanceIndex(1);
492            }
493            return context.getCurrentIndex();
494        }
495    }
496
497    /**
498     * This MatcherVisitor collects the minimal set of actions that has to run underneath a resyncronization sequence
499     * in order to maintain a consistent Value Stack state.
500     */
501    private static class CollectResyncActionsVisitor extends DefaultMatcherVisitor<List<ActionMatcher>> {
502        private ImmutableLinkedList<SequenceMatcher> path = ImmutableLinkedList.nil();
503
504        @Override
505        public List<ActionMatcher> visit(ActionMatcher matcher) {
506            return ImmutableList.of(matcher);
507        }
508
509        @Override
510        public List<ActionMatcher> visit(FirstOfMatcher matcher) {
511            for (Matcher child : matcher.getChildren()) {
512                List<ActionMatcher> actions = child.accept(this);
513                if (actions != null) return actions;
514            }
515            return null;
516        }
517
518        @Override
519        public List<ActionMatcher> visit(OneOrMoreMatcher matcher) {
520            return matcher.subMatcher.accept(this);
521        }
522
523        @Override
524        public List<ActionMatcher> visit(SequenceMatcher matcher) {
525            if (path.contains(matcher)) {
526                return null;
527            }
528
529            ImmutableLinkedList<SequenceMatcher> previousPath = path;
530            path = path.prepend(matcher);
531
532            List<ActionMatcher> actions = new ArrayList<ActionMatcher>();
533            for (Matcher sub : matcher.getChildren()) {
534                List<ActionMatcher> subActions = sub.accept(this);
535                if (subActions == null) return null;
536                actions.addAll(subActions);
537            }
538
539            path = previousPath;
540            return actions;
541        }
542
543        @Override
544        public List<ActionMatcher> defaultValue(AbstractMatcher matcher) {
545            return ImmutableList.of();
546        }
547    }
548}
